Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue ".NET Core November Update - 2.1.6 and SDK 2.1.500" (#91) at dotnet/announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
# November 2018 .NET Updates

The following .NET updates were released in November 2018. This issue will be updated if there are any additional releases during the month.

## .NET Core

* [.NET Core November 2018 (2.1.6 and SDK 2.1.500) Update release notes](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/2.1/2.1.6/2.1.6.md)

A [discussion issue](https://github.com/dotnet/core/issues/2053) is available for questions or feedback about this release.

## .NET Support Policies

Microsoft support policies are defined in the following documents:

* [Microsoft .NET Support Policy](https://www.microsoft.com/net/support/policy)
* [.NET Core OS Lifecycle Policy](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/os-lifecycle-policy.md)

## Previous Updates
* [October 2018[(https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/89)
* [September 2018](https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/84)
* [August 2018](https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/79)
* [July 2018](https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/76)
* [June 2018](https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/75)
* [May 2018](https://github.com/dotnet/announcements/issues/68)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CancellationToken.Register with 'useSynchronizationContext = true' doesn't work on UWP" (#21183) at dotnet/coreclr
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi.
When I try to use CancellationToken.Register with 'useSynchronizationContext = true', it throws "NotSupportedException: Send is not supported in the Windows Runtime SynchronizationContext" after token was cancelled. 
I think, Exception goes from line [#L669](https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/master/src/System.Private.CoreLib/src/System/Threading/CancellationTokenSource.cs#L669)

I need to run code on UI thread, when token is cancelled, so 'useSynchronizationContext = true' is required for me. 
I can pass context manually or invoke Dispather.RunAsync and it will work, but useSynchronizationContext should work also or throw NotSupportedException when Register is invoked, not after token was cancelled, so it can be easier to find the problem.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix Interop/PInvoke/Miscellaneous/HandleRef tests under GCStress" (#21131) at dotnet/coreclr
Events.RelatedBody:
Emit a `GC.KeepAlive` call for the object wrapped in a `HandleRef` when marshalling a `HandleRef` to native code. Also, add an extra `GC.KeepAlive` for an object in the test that needs to live across the call but wasn't referenced after the P/Invoke originally.

Fixes #21115

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "free(): invalid pointer" (#21182) at dotnet/coreclr
Events.RelatedBody:
.NET Core 2.1.6
Raspberry PI 3 B+
Latest Rasbian Lite 

I have a small app that I am doing some work in talking to a temperature sensor (MLX90164).  This communicates via I2C using the WiringPi library via Unosquare.RaspberryIO Nuget package.  I can view the source code for the NuGet package and the C library for wiringPi.  Only a single file handle is ever allocated, and as far as I can tell, thats not where the issue is.

If I run my program, it will abort with:

`*** Error in `/home/pi/Development/publish/TestApp': free(): invalid pointer: 0x76d65694 ***`

Running under gdb, I can get the following output.

```
[New Thread 0x6e153450 (LWP 14342)]
Ambient Temp (C): 21.71  -  Object Temp (C): 21.63
[Thread 0x6e153450 (LWP 14342) exited]
[New Thread 0x6e153450 (LWP 14347)]
Ambient Temp (C): 21.71  -  Object Temp (C): 21.61
[Thread 0x6e153450 (LWP 14347) exited]
[New Thread 0x6e153450 (LWP 14348)]
*** Error in `/home/pi/Development/publish/TestApp': free(): invalid pointer: 0x76d65694 ***

Thread 1105 "TestApp" received signal SIGABRT, Aborted.
[Switching to Thread 0x6dfff450 (LWP 14330)]
__GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:51
51	../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c: No such file or directory.
(gdb) bt
#0  __GI_raise (sig=sig@entry=6) at ../sysdeps/unix/sysv/linux/raise.c:51
#1  0x76c73824 in __GI_abort () at abort.c:89
#2  0x76cacf78 in __libc_message (do_abort=do_abort@entry=2, fmt=<optimized out>) at ../sysdeps/posix/libc_fatal.c:175
#3  0x76cb3ad4 in malloc_printerr (action=<optimized out>, str=0x76d66040 "free(): invalid pointer", ptr=<optimized out>, ar_ptr=<optimized out>) at malloc.c:5049
#4  0x76cb4514 in _int_free (av=0x76d82794 <main_arena>, p=0x76d6568c, have_lock=<optimized out>) at malloc.c:3905
#5  0x768e7030 in HeapFree () from /home/pi/Development/publish/libcoreclr.so
#6  0x768e70ea in LocalFree () from /home/pi/Development/publish/libcoreclr.so
#7  0x6c5a12d0 in ?? ()
Backtrace stopped: previous frame identical to this frame (corrupt stack?)
(gdb) 

```

I have uploaded a simple test case at the following location.

https://1drv.ms/u/s!Aq5b3zEUkJG5gqQG5f2xH9-KhwlBVw

I have other sensors that do not have this issue. Strange this its just this one. You will need the MLX90614 sensor to test this.

https://www.amazon.com/KNACRO-MLX90614ESF-Temperature-Thermometer-Interface/dp/B06WVGD8WJ/

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Make sure Signing target finds packages to sign" (#978) at dotnet/standard
Events.RelatedBody:
This will fix a build error where we can't find any packages to sign. The problem was caused by me moving the `PackageOutputPath` property from `Directory.Build.props` to `Directory.Build.targets`, which was a workaround to allow us to continue outputting packages to the bin dir while using Arcade's packaging tasks. Once we're outputting packages to `artifacts`, we can revert this PR.

CC @danmosemsft @JohnTortugo

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Proposal: improve System.Guid performance with LayoutKind.Explicit and static arrays" (#33684) at dotnet/corefx
Events.RelatedBody:
I am not sure about possibility to use LayoutKind.Explicit for [System.Cuid](https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/blob/master/src/Common/src/CoreLib/System/Guid.cs) and to add several fields, although all proposed changes are (binary) compatible with current implementation. That's why I made a [separate repository](https://github.com/OlegAxenow/FastGuid) with several benchmarks. 

Are these changes acceptable? If yes, I'll try to write a pull request.

## Changes details

1. [5 fields](https://github.com/OlegAxenow/FastGuid/blob/master/FastGuid/Uuid.cs) added for ```Equals``` and ```CompareTo``` methods. [16 (byte) fields](https://github.com/OlegAxenow/FastGuid/blob/master/FastGuid/Uuid.Formattable.cs) added for ```ToString``` and ```TryParseExact``` methods.
2. ```Equals``` and ```CompareTo``` methods have become faster due to less comparisons (with less fields).
3. ```ToString``` and ```TryParseExact``` methods have become faster due to using [static arrays](https://github.com/OlegAxenow/FastGuid/blob/master/FastGuid/StaticData.cs).


## Benchmarks

* "Guid" prefix used for original ```System.Guid``` methods, "Uuid" — for ```FastGuid.Uuid``` methods.
* For ```CompareTo``` and ```Equals``` two benchmarks used for each struct to see the difference between comparing the same and different identifiers.
* For ```CompareTo``` and ```Equals``` appropriate methods called thrice like ```_guid1.CompareTo(_guid2) ^ _guid2.CompareTo(_guid3) ^ _guid3.CompareTo(_guid1)```.
* For ```ToString``` last letter means one of the [standard guid formats](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.guid.tostring?view=netcore-2.1) — D, B, N or X.

### CompareTo

|               Method |      Mean |     Error |    StdDev |       Min |       Max | Ratio |
|--------------------- |----------:|----------:|----------:|----------:|----------:|------:|
| GuidDifferentCompare |  8.019 ns | 0.0194 ns | 0.0162 ns |  8.001 ns |  8.063 ns |  1.00 |
|      GuidSameCompare | 24.242 ns | 0.0817 ns | 0.0764 ns | 24.102 ns | 24.335 ns |  3.02 |
| UuidDifferentCompare |  3.862 ns | 0.0056 ns | 0.0053 ns |  3.855 ns |  3.870 ns |  0.48 |
|      UuidSameCompare | 13.991 ns | 0.0711 ns | 0.0665 ns | 13.903 ns | 14.110 ns |  1.75 |

### Equals

|              Method |     Mean |     Error |    StdDev |      Min |      Max | Ratio |
|-------------------- |---------:|----------:|----------:|---------:|---------:|------:|
| GuidDifferentEquals | 5.866 ns | 0.0185 ns | 0.0173 ns | 5.833 ns | 5.891 ns |  1.00 |
|      GuidSameEquals | 7.537 ns | 0.0067 ns | 0.0059 ns | 7.525 ns | 7.549 ns |  1.29 |
| UuidDifferentEquals | 2.387 ns | 0.0080 ns | 0.0067 ns | 2.378 ns | 2.401 ns |  0.41 |
|      UuidSameEquals | 4.034 ns | 0.0138 ns | 0.0129 ns | 4.000 ns | 4.051 ns |  0.69 |

### ToString

|        Method |     Mean |     Error |    StdDev |      Min |      Max | Ratio |
|-------------- |---------:|----------:|----------:|---------:|---------:|------:|
| GuidToStringD | 59.02 ns | 0.1131 ns | 0.1058 ns | 58.82 ns | 59.21 ns |  1.00 |
| GuidToStringB | 59.08 ns | 0.1472 ns | 0.1377 ns | 58.87 ns | 59.35 ns |  1.00 |
| GuidToStringN | 61.67 ns | 0.0938 ns | 0.0783 ns | 61.56 ns | 61.81 ns |  1.05 |
| GuidToStringX | 68.10 ns | 0.3475 ns | 0.3251 ns | 67.59 ns | 68.69 ns |  1.15 |
| UuidToStringD | 24.95 ns | 0.0414 ns | 0.0346 ns | 24.91 ns | 25.01 ns |  0.42 |
| UuidToStringB | 28.32 ns | 0.0455 ns | 0.0404 ns | 28.26 ns | 28.40 ns |  0.48 |
| UuidToStringN | 24.01 ns | 0.0446 ns | 0.0396 ns | 23.96 ns | 24.11 ns |  0.41 |
| UuidToStringX | 33.82 ns | 0.1509 ns | 0.1411 ns | 33.56 ns | 34.04 ns |  0.57 |

### TryParseExact

|             Method |      Mean |     Error |    StdDev |    Median |       Min |       Max | Ratio |
|------------------- |----------:|----------:|----------:|----------:|----------:|----------:|------:|
| GuidTryParseExactD | 295.73 ns | 0.5214 ns | 0.6207 ns | 295.67 ns | 294.35 ns | 297.03 ns |  1.00 |
| GuidTryParseExactB | 293.97 ns | 1.0966 ns | 1.3468 ns | 294.20 ns | 288.35 ns | 295.10 ns |  0.99 |
| GuidTryParseExactN | 417.32 ns | 0.4367 ns | 0.5522 ns | 417.35 ns | 416.38 ns | 418.63 ns |  1.41 |
| GuidTryParseExactX | 697.23 ns | 1.3468 ns | 1.6540 ns | 697.81 ns | 693.32 ns | 699.37 ns |  2.36 |
| UuidTryParseExactD |  39.67 ns | 0.3329 ns | 0.4444 ns |  39.42 ns |  39.30 ns |  40.74 ns |  0.13 |
| UuidTryParseExactB |  40.94 ns | 0.2564 ns | 0.3423 ns |  41.07 ns |  40.10 ns |  41.15 ns |  0.14 |
| UuidTryParseExactN |  39.86 ns | 0.1022 ns | 0.1217 ns |  39.81 ns |  39.73 ns |  40.19 ns |  0.13 |
| UuidTryParseExactX |  44.96 ns | 0.1092 ns | 0.1458 ns |  45.01 ns |  44.69 ns |  45.13 ns |  0.15 |

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Interpreter] Locals and operators" (#6611) at dotnet/corert
Events.RelatedBody:
The PR extends the interpreter to support locals and some operator opcodes:

### Locals

* stloc.*
* ldloc.*

### Unary operators

* not
* neg
* pop
* dup

### Conversion operators

* conv.*
* conv.ovf.*

### Bitwise Shift operators

* shl
* shr*

The CoreCLR interpreter (https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/blob/master/src/vm/interpreter.cpp) was used as a development reference. However, I'm still not very confident about my implementation of the conversion and bitwise shift operators especially around things relating to type casting and general code structure.

cc @jkotas @MichalStrehovsky @morganbr

Events.RelatedBody: https://github.com/dotnet/coreclr/pull/20788 added some new functions to `System.Math` and `System.MathF`, we should update the CoreRT native compiler to support these new methods.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "UWP - .Net Native - " (#6384) at dotnet/corert
Events.RelatedBody:
# Problem
When compiling in release mode with the .net native toolchain (which I think is required for publishing to the store) the application throws the following exception:

`
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: 'The system cannot find the file specified. (Exception from HRESULT: 0x80070002)'
`

here is the stack trace, I think it could origin from the "CanRestoreSessionState" but I am not sure.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13090415/46176585-3f7d2980-c2b0-11e8-86b8-671f552364a7.png)

If I compile the code in Debug mode or disable "compile with .net native toolchain" in Release mode everything works as expected.

**Default.rd.xml**
`
<Directives xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/netfx/2013/01/metadata">
  <Application>
    <Assembly Name="*Application*" Dynamic="Required All" />
  </Application>
</Directives>
`

# Configuration

Microsoft Visual Studio Enterprise 2017 
Version 15.8.3
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.8.3+28010.2019
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.03056

Visual Studio Tools for Universal Windows Apps   15.0.28010.00

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Implement new math helpers" (#6609) at dotnet/corert
Events.RelatedBody: Fixes #6577.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Add two xunit packages to runtime.depproj to unblock about 90 tests" (#6607) at dotnet/corert
Events.RelatedBody:
This change adds the packages "xunit.core" and "xunit.performance.core"
required by some CoreCLR tests to external test dependencies. I have
copied the clauses from external.depproj in CoreCLR and their versions
from dependency.props. This change reduces the number of failures from
346 to 254.

Thanks

Tomas

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update RyuJIT" (#6606) at dotnet/corert
Events.RelatedBody: Picks up dotnet/coreclr#21163. Fixes #6601.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Report CORINFO_FIELD_INTRINSIC_EMPTY_STRING to RyuJIT" (#6601) at dotnet/corert
Events.RelatedBody:
We are not reporting `CORINFO_FIELD_INTRINSIC_EMPTY_STRING` to RyuJIT because it's hitting what appears to be a RyuJIT bug in late devirtualization (see assert in the jitdump). Likely because our string literals are different than string literals RyuJIT normally sees in CoreCLR.

To repro, uncomment the line in CorInfoImpl.cs that references this issue and build a multimodule release System.Private.CoreLib.

[jitdump.txt](https://github.com/dotnet/corert/files/2604999/jitdump.txt)
